title: Fed’s preferred inflation gauge gives Jerome Powell green light to cut rates after prices barely budge
description: Excluding the volatile food and energy categories, core prices rose 0.2% in September from August, the same as the previous month, accoring to a report that was delayed five weeks by the government shutdown.
content:
The Federal Reserves preferred measure of inflation changed little in September, likely easing the way to a widely expected interest rate cut by the central bank next week.
